course.subject: IEDA
course.name: Data Driven Supply Chain Management
course.description: An introduction to the design, development, and management of integrated logistics supply chain systems, including inventory management, distribution channels, and information systems. Emphasis on the impact of e-business on companies and industries, especially how the Internet changes the way in which goods and services flow through the value chain from manufacturers to customers.
course.exclusions: EEMT 5300, ISOM 3770

reviews.author: Noknok
reviews.comment_content:
1 Introduction  
2 Inventory management
3 Risk pooling strategies
4 Bullwhip effect controlling
5 Outsourcing
6 Postponement
7 Smart pricing
8 Supply contracts and risk sharing
9 Sharing Economy
10 Supply Chain Design Strategies

And 8 case studies
reviews.comment_teaching: She teaches it in a clear way, and makes it super easy to understand, with a lot of examples and practice questions allowing us to master the content.
reviews.comment_grading:
Homework 5%
Class participation 15%
Project 15%
Mid-term exam 25%
Final Exam 40%

The grading and marks are not transparent.
reviews.comment_workload: Fine in general. But some case studies have too much content to read, which shall be completed at home before the lesson.

reviews.author: Mason Mount
reviews.title: Quite business
reviews.comment_content:
Teaching and some case studies

1 Introduction  
2 Inventory management
3 Risk pooling strategies
Case 1: Sport Obermeyer
4 Bullwhip effect controlling
Case 2: Barilla SpA
5 Outsourcing
Case 3: Zara: Fast Fashion
6 Postponement
Case 4: HP
Case 5: Zara: An integrated store and online model
7 Smart pricing
Case 6: Allegiant Airline
8 Supply contracts and risk sharing
9 Sharing Economy
Case 7: Uber
10 Supply Chain Design Strategies
Case 8: Apple Global Supply Chain
reviews.comment_grading:
Homework                 5%
Class participation    15%
Project                      15%
Mid-term exam          25%
Final Exam                40%

Class participation = answering questions during case studies
The grading is not transparent, only scores of homeworks and mid-term exam are shown
reviews.comment_workload:
2 homeworks
8 Case studies with a lot of words needed to be read
Group project is short but still needs some time to finish
